Agricultural Engineering.1: Apply knowledge of mathematics, physical sciences, and the engineering sciences.
Agricultural Engineering.2: Apply knowledge of agriculture, natural resources, and agricultural engineering.
Agricultural Engineering.3: Design and conduct experiments, utilize probability and statistics, as well as to analyze and interpret data.
Agricultural Engineering.4: Design a system, component, or process to meet desired needs.
Agricultural Engineering.5: Function on teams, including multi-disciplinary teams.
Agricultural Engineering.6: Identify, formulate, and solve engineering problems.
Agricultural Engineering.9: Understand the impact of engineering solutions in a global and societal context.
Agricultural Engineering.10: Recognize the need for, and an ability to engage in, life-long learning.
Agricultural Engineering.12: Use the techniques, skills, and modern engineering tools necessary for engineering practice.
